general_advisory: The overall crop condition is normal. Top dressing of fertilizer is ongoing. Harvesting of crops like maize has started. Sugarcane is at a grand growth stage. Farmers are advised to control pests and diseases based on specific recommendations.

advisory: False smut: Spray Propiconazole or Hexaconazole @ 100 ml or Copper oxychloride @ 250 g in 200 lt of water per acre
Neck Blast: Drain excess water and spray Hexaconazole or Azoxystrobin+ Difenoconazole
Pod Borer Management: Spray Emamectin Benzoate 5% SG @ 80 ml/acre or Profenophos 50 % EC @ 400 ml/acre
Pod Borer Management: Spray Emamectin Benzoate 5% SG @ 80 ml/acre or Profenophos 50 % EC @ 400 ml/acre
Seed treatment should be done with Carbendazim 50% WP @ 2 g/kg of seeds or Carboxin 37.5 % + Thiram 37.5% D.S @ 3 g/kg of seeds
To manage Fruit flies infestation, spray Malathion @ 1 ml/lt
To control Powdery mildew disease, spray Dinocap @ 1 ml/lt or Carbendazim @ 1 g/lt
To reduce Phomopsis blight disease, spray Metalaxyl + Mancozeb Zineb 75% WP @ 500 g/acre in 200 litres of water
